Origins: The above-reproduced statement about homophobia was a quip that came to be attributed to Academy Award-winning actor Morgan Freeman in August 2012. However, Morgan Freeman neither originated nor repeated those words: they came to be associated with his name through a 12 August 2012 Twitter entry posted to the now-defunct Tweets from God feed, a humor site which represented itself with an image of the actor portraying God in the film Bruce Almighty .
Description: The "Tweets from God" Twitter page included a disclaimer noting that "This account is not associated with Morgon Freeman [sic], it's just a parody!"
Example: [Collected via e-mail, September 2012] For a few days now i have seen a post on Facebook that says: 'I hate the word homophobia. It's not a phobia. You are not scared; you are an asshole.' Well, today I see that it has suddenly been attributed to Morgan Freeman.
Claim: Tweet reproduces actor Morgan Freeman's statement about homophobia.
